clause_text: User stories should be independent and not overlap or depend directly on other stories.
Stories must describe user value without fixing a technical solution, allowing negotiation.
Each story must clearly deliver value to a specific user or stakeholder.
Stories should be small enough that developers can estimate the effort confidently.
Stories should be deliverable within one sprint and focus on a single outcome.
Acceptance criteria must be specific and measurable to allow verification.
All output in HTL templates must use context-aware escaping to prevent XSS.
JSP scripting is disallowed in AEM Cloud Service; use HTL or Sling Models instead.
Dispatcher must cache anonymous GET requests for HTML pages under /content.
When content is published or deactivated, related Dispatcher cache entries must be invalidated automatically.
Responses must include cache-control headers compatible with Dispatcher caching.
All images in authored pages must provide alt text to ensure accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1).
Custom code must be deployed under /apps and treated as immutable (read-only) in AEM Cloud Service.
Client libraries (clientlibs) should be minified and versioned to improve load time and caching.
Content Fragments exposed through GraphQL APIs must validate allowed models and fields only.
Authoring workflows must include review and activation steps before content goes live.
Requirements must use clear and unambiguous language avoiding vague terms.
Success criteria must include specific measurable metrics.
Requirements must be traceable to business objectives.
All necessary information must be included for implementation.
Requirements must not contradict each other.
Each requirement must have clear verification criteria.
Requirements must identify the target user or stakeholder.
Requirements should indicate priority or business value.
Requirements should include justification or business reason.
Acceptance criteria must be agreed upon by stakeholders.
Requirements should follow standard user story format.
External dependencies must be explicitly documented.
Assumptions and constraints must be stated clearly.
Performance and quality attributes must be quantified.
Story scope must be clearly bounded and specific.
